messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1258
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, I think that the cousin who quit school  sounds like an unschooler.  I would advise him not to take the GED, but if he already has, disregard it. In
messages.messageBody:
Hi,
I think that the cousin who quit school sounds like an unschooler. I
would advise him not to take the GED, but if he already has, disregard it.
In Friendship,
Part American Indian Wendy- who likes to learn from and remember the past, ,
but doesn't think it is beneficial or respectful to pity a strong people or
to be hateful on their behalf. Lots of Indian culture survives, and many
people are drawn to it. There are even people in Europe who love and embrace
it-probably other places around the globe as well.
